There's no existing configuration option to disable end-of-crawl 
reports. The StatisticsTracker assumes you want reports (see how its 
crawlEnded() method calls dumpReports()), and it's generally assumed a 
StatisticsTracker will be present.

However, since that's handled by the public method 
StatisticsTracker.dumpReports(), simply creating your own subclass of 
StatisticsTracker that doesn't do anything there should do the trick.

And further, a feature of the Spring configuration framework we're using 
is that you can even create new classes *in your configuration file(s)* 
-- sparing you the need to add an Java classes to your build. See:

http://static.springsource.org/spring/docs/2.5.x/reference/dynamic-language.html#dynamic-language-beans

So it shouldn't be hard to suppress reports in your crawls. We'd also 
welcome a patch that makes whether all reports are dumped, or the list 
of reports available or auto-dumped, crawl operator configurable through 
toggles or a named list.

- Gordon @ IA

On 12/15/10 7:17 PM, Zach Bailey wrote:
>
>
> Are there any configuration options available (either on the crawl
> controller or the frontier) to disable the report writing when a crawl
> finishes or is terminated?
>
> I'm not using the generated reports for anything and it's keeping me
> from being able to quickly turn around and perform another crawl until
> the previous crawl is finished thrashing the disk by pulling info out of
> BDB. It also obviously keeps the heap full until it's done which has
> severe performance impacts when trying to start another crawl after one
> finishes.
>
